alert.note: Alert for Kershaw; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 7:56PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following areas, Kershaw and Richland. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 754 PM EDT, Rain gauge reports near Elgin have indicated over 3 inches of rain has fallen since 630 pm. Radar also continued to indicate heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbia, Elgin, Lugoff, Lake Carolina and Pine Grove Fire Station. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 81 and 95. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Flooded roadways are nearly impossible to see at night. Avoid traveling in this area. Turn around, don`t drown.
